channel.title: Finches on murmuring in the background
channel.description: Recent content in Finches on murmuring in the background

item.title: comparing pairwise and multivariate correlation networks
item.description: In each construction, two variables are linked in the network when their association is both discernible and strong. “Discernibility” has to do with the detection of a statistical signal, and is a cautious substitution for the misleading and often-abused term “significance”. “Strength” has to do with the size of the relative amount by which change in one variable predicts change in the other, assuming the pattern in the data reflects the latent relationship (and would be a better referent for “significance” anyway).
